value.title: Ultimate Beginners Guide To DAX 2020 - Course Intro

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how you can use GROUPBY function in DAX to create an aggregated table. In this video, I'll explain how you can use Summarize function for the same purpose. Summarize function gives you more control on how to create your aggregated table with some extra functions. Let's

value.title: Creating a Table in Power BI Using DAX Table Constructor
value.excerpt: There are some functions in DAX that are useful in very specific scenarios. For example, sometimes, you might want to create a table entirely in DAX. If you want to do that, what are your ways and how it is possible? This might be helpful especially in the first days of learning about DAX. Let's see

value.title: Blank row in DAX

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #06: Using ALLSELECTED

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Counting working days in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes a DAX technique to compute the number of working days between two dates. Article and download: https://sql.bi/80301

value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Dynamic Rolling Average with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a dynamic 7 day or 30 day rolling average wiht DAX What-IF parameters with ease. Create a dynmaic dashboard board that provides immedicate insight.   Check me out on Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #29: HASONEVALUE
value.excerpt: Have you ever got this error message?: A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected ?  If you have, make sure to check out this video to understand how to solve it.  HASONEVALUE is a DAX function that will check if the table returned has one value or not. If it has, it will
